The Freetype2-only mode of the Gtk+ and Qt gfx back ends doesn't appear to have worked in some time, and clutters up various files with #ifdefs.  This patch strips it out.

Note that the various FT2-specific files are all still used by other back ends.

comments.text:
Comment on attachment 523440
patch

(In reply to comment #3)
> If it still works, I'm fine with keeping it,

Yes, we should keep the gtk/freetype combination for debugging the freetype backend on desktop.  And the future for the Qt port is freetype.

> but can we rearrange things to get
> as many ifdefs as possible out of the gfxPlatform* files?

I'm not clear what you have in mind here.  There are completely different gfxPlatform implementations for different font backends.  I haven't really found the use of subtype polymorphism with base and platform-specific implementations particularly helpful for following the code, though that would be much better if there were no method overrides.  I wonder whether #ifdefs are clearer in some cases.  Separate files may be an option, but gfx/thebes/ is already hard to navigate so I'm cautious about adding too many more files.
